biblStruct.note: "It is my case, however that his popularity and authority within Syrian christianity should not be understimated and, indeed, that any exposition of the development of Syrian theology which fails to consider at least the possibility of his influence cannot be regarded as truly comprehensive. Before describing the nature and extent of the Basilian writings preserved in Syriac I wish to begin by recounting a popular legend which describes the meeting in Caesarea between St. Basil and [...] Ephraim." (pp. 49-50)
